name: The Heidelberg Tee (Black)
description:
Turning a street on the city's east side into a colorful art installation, artist Tyree Guyton began The Heidelberg Project back in 1986. In that time The Heidelberg Project has become an attraction for tourists and locals alike. Some think it's art, others an eye-sore. Recently, The Heidelberg Project has been victim to serial arson attacks, burning Tyree's work to ashes. Only four houses remain from the original eight. After all of this, Tyree's response was simple, "We'll just put something bigger and better in its place". The Heidelberg Tee is a water-based print on a standard, unisex Alternative Apparel crew. A portion of the profits from the sale of this shirt will be donated directly to The Heidelberg Project to help them accomplish the goal of building something bigger and better. You can also donate here. Tell your friends:
Fancy

name: The NY Fashion Weak Tee
description:
Never will you ever find a bigger room full of more people taking pictures of other people who you've never heard of then at NYC's famed fashion week. We here in Detroit, we aren't mad at fashion. In fact, we hope that (one day) we'll have a fashion district here full of hipsters, young creatives, and the midwest savvy. Who knows, maybe one day we'll have General Motors Fashion Week here in the D. Tell your friends:

name: The Boblo Tee
description:
Where the fuck is Boblo Island? Boblo Island Amusement Park was located on Bois Blanc Island, Ontario. Just above the mouth of the Detroit River, the residents of Detroit regarded it as their Coney Island. Running from 1898 until its closure on September 30, 1993; the park was accessed by ferries that would dock at Port Detroit. Now you know. The Boblo Tee features a water-based white print on a vintage black, destroyed tee. This tee has ground collar, sleeves and bottom hem for a more worn-in look. Tell your friends:
Fancy

name: The Eazy Fitted
description:
Corktown is the oldest neighborhood inside of the city of Detroit and is referred to (inside of the Blonde office) as the Brooklyn of our fair city. While Corktown holds some sad parts of the city- most notably Michigan Central Train Station and the spot that Tigers Stadium once stood, it also holds some of our bright spots- Astro Coffee, Slows BBQ, Sugar House. Since some of our best, and most creative are coming "straight outta Corktown", we thought it would be best to pay homage to them with a hat that (we think) Eazy would be proud of. Enter, our Eazy Fitted. Tell your friends:
Fancy

name: The Mover Art
description:
Love it or hate it, the Detroit People Mover has been ushering around business professionals, sports fans and tourists alike for 25 years and is a visual staple of the city. The mover's two-million riders (on average) can make their way around 3 square miles of the city, spread over 13 stations. "The Mover Art" celebrates this staple of the city by showcasing six of the 13 stations. Tell your friends:

name: The SAUF Tee
description:
Detroit has a growing bike culture. If you're not hip to this yet, just spend a little time with the cats over at Wheelhouse Detroit or the Detroit Bicycle Company and we're sure you'll convert fast. To celebrate this growing mode of transport, we are happy to offer up our SAUF tee. In France, these signs line their bike-ways and the (rough) translation is: "Except for Bikes". Tell your friends:

name: The Kocham Tee
description:
Just outside of the city of Detroit is a small gem by the name of Hamtramck, which is home to The Planet Ant Theatre, the Hamtramck Blowout and a rather large Polish population. The immigrants that flooded into the city gave it life, numerous Polish bakeries and the Kowalski Sausage Co which has been manufacturing goods throughout Detroit for over 85 years. To celebrate this great culture piece of the city, Blonde is proud to issue "The Kocham Tee". A black, slub-rocker tee, vintage printed (for a soft feel) with a "Kocham Cię Detroit" graphic (means "I Love You Detroit" in Polish). Tell your friends:
Fancy

name: The Derby Hoodie
description:
Established in 1978, the Motor City Rollers were the first in a series of underground derby teams that would meet in and around the city to practice and perform their craft. The derby meets were always kept secret and private, those who were there only had stories and memories to pass along after the night ended (as no photos were allowed). Rumor has it that the last of the derby matches were held in late 1985. In 2005, derby would return to the city of Detroit thanks to the Detroit Derby Girls. As part of the Women's Flat Track Derby Association, the Derby Girls encompass five teams and usually hold matches at Cobo Hall or the Masonic Temple Tell your friends:
Fancy

name: The DJ Tee
description:
Give the DJ some. Detroit wasn't only the birthplace of Motown, it was also the home to the beginnings of Techno. Regardless of musical backgrounds, the city harbors a large number of impressive DJ's. On any given weekend you can fill your ears with slow jams at Woodbridge Pub, deep house at TV Bar and nu-disco at The Old Miami. When you are out, make sure to give the DJ the respect they deserve and rock this shirt. Oh... And stop making requests. Tell your friends:

name: The Anatomical Tee
description:
Artist Series | Volume Two The first time we laid eyes on the ink-works of Vincent Cervantez we were blown away by the details and texture within. We watched as he smudged and smeared the soot-black-ink into his dark-themed creations (and all over his hands) as if he was pushing some sort of pain into the paper. With our collaboration, we are proud to offer his Anatomical Heart print up on a super soft, organic, Alternative Apparel tee. We also hope to offer a new take on "wearing your heart on your sleeve". - Limited run of 30 Tell your friends:
Fancy

name: The O.G. Tee
description:
From Saunderson to Atkins to Craig; no matter how it's made or what label it's on... Detroit techno is the original people mover. Designed for our friend (and curator of our Blonde No. 3 Mix) Erno the Inferno, The O.G. Tee was conceived as a companion to our DJ Tee. This time, it's all about the music. After getting the OK on the design from ETI, we rushed to get this tee ready for the Detroit Electronic Music Festival (or Movement/DEMF). Hot off the press, it is here in a limited run of 20 units and you can only get it here. Tell your friends:

name: The Twiggy Tee
description:
First came Edie. This time, we highlight Twiggy. Lesley Lawson (better known to most as Twiggy) became the face of the "swinging 60's" London movement in the early 1960's. At only 16 years old, with her big eyes and androgynous looks, Twiggy took the world by storm. "I hated what I looked like," she said once, "so I thought everyone had gone stark raving mad."
